That's a great approach! Scanning the old photo albums and documents using a flatbed scanner is a wonderful way to preserve them and make them easier to work with. By digitizing them, you'll be able to share them with family and friends, and also have a backup in case the originals are damaged or lost.

Remember to handle the originals with care, as they are precious family heirlooms. Make sure to store them in a safe place, away from direct sunlight, moisture, and extreme temperatures.

I'm thrilled to hear that you feel more confident about creating a memory book for your grandmother. It's a beautiful way to celebrate her life and share her story with your loved ones. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance.

Remember, the most important thing is to have fun and enjoy the process of creating this memory book. It's a labor of love, and your grandmother would be proud of you for taking the time to honor her memory in such a meaningful way.

Good luck, and I hope you have a wonderful time creating your grandmother's memory book!
